### PR summary [98d4aa137e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14185/commits/98d4aa137e49dc5e14499f69faeb3de25905ea2f)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ measurePreserving_pi`
`+ volume_preserving_pi`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9931703526/job/27431941306)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9931703526/job/27431941216)
You are assuming that the `f i` are measurable equivalences, but this should be true for any map, right?

Right. I got a bit lazy here. It's fixed in the new version (and the proof is actually shorter). Thanks!

 I also added a `volume` version of the result since it seems that many results in this file are stated both ways.

Can't you deduce the sigma-finiteness of `mu i` from the one of `nu i` instead of assuming it, thanks to [MeasureTheory.MeasurePreserving.sigmaFinite](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Dynamics/Ergodic/MeasurePreserving.html#MeasureTheory.MeasurePreserving.sigmaFinite)? Same thing for the next lemma.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MeasureTheory/Constructions/Pi): add `measurePreserving_pi`
